llmSelectionInfo.intro: Artemis offers you three ways to use AI assistance for your learning. You decide which option best fits your needs and privacy preferences.
llmSelectionInfo.cloudWhatIsIt: Cloud AI uses state-of-the-art language models from OpenAI (GPT-4, GPT-5) and other leading providers, hosted on Microsoft Azure's infrastructure within the European Union.
llmSelectionInfo.cloudHowDoesItWork: When you interact with Iris or request AI feedback, your questions and exercise content are sent to Azure datacenters in the EU for processing. The AI generates responses that are then displayed in Artemis.
llmSelectionInfo.cloudData3: Code you've written for programming exercises
llmSelectionInfo.cloudDataNot1: Your personal information (name, matriculation number, email)
llmSelectionInfo.cloudBenefit1: Access to the most advanced AI technology available
llmSelectionInfo.cloudBenefit3: Best answer quality and reasoning capabilities
llmSelectionInfo.cloudBenefit4: Automatic access to new model versions
llmSelectionInfo.cloudSecurity1: All processing follows EU data protection regulations
llmSelectionInfo.cloudSecurity2: Your data never leaves the European Union
llmSelectionInfo.cloudSecurity4: Your data is never used to train or improve AI models
llmSelectionInfo.localWhatIsIt: Local AI uses open-source language models (such as Gemma, Llama) that run exclusively on the Technical University of Munich's own GPU infrastructure.
llmSelectionInfo.localHowDoesItWork: All AI processing happens on university-owned servers in our datacenter. Your data never leaves the university's network.
llmSelectionInfo.localDataProcessed: Same as Cloud AI, but everything stays within TUM infrastructure.
llmSelectionInfo.localBenefit2: University has full control over the infrastructure
llmSelectionInfo.localLimit1: Typically 5-15 seconds depending on server load
llmSelectionInfo.localLimit2: Open-source models currently lag behind commercial models
llmSelectionInfo.localLimit3: Feature is still being developed and improved
llmSelectionInfo.localLimit4: May be unavailable during maintenance or high load
llmSelectionInfo.localWhyExperimental: We're continuously working to improve our local AI infrastructure. Response quality and speed will improve over time as we upgrade our models and hardware.
llmSelectionInfo.noAiWhatIsIt: You can use Artemis without any AI assistance. All core features remain fully functional.
llmSelectionInfo.noAiDoesnt1: The AI tutor won't be available
llmSelectionInfo.noAiDoesnt2: No automated feedback on text and modeling exercises
llmSelectionInfo.noAiWhen1: You prefer not to use AI for learning
llmSelectionInfo.noAiWhen2: You want maximum privacy without any AI processing
llmSelectionInfo.noAiWhen4: You want to rely solely on human tutors and instructors
llmSelectionInfo.changingChoiceText: You can change your AI preference at any time in your Account Settings under AI Usage. Your choice applies immediately to all AI features in Artemis.
llmSelectionInfo.dataStorageIntro: Regardless of your AI choice, your core data (grades, submissions, personal information) is always stored on university servers and never shared with external AI providers.
llmSelectionInfo.cloudAiStorage: Exercise content sent to Azure for processing only, not stored there
llmSelectionInfo.faq1Question: Is my data safe with Cloud AI?
llmSelectionInfo.faq1Answer: Yes. We use enterprise contracts with strict data protection agreements. Your data is processed only for generating responses and is not stored or used for model training.
llmSelectionInfo.faq2Question: Can instructors see my AI choice?
llmSelectionInfo.faq2Answer: No. Your AI preference is private and not visible to instructors or other students.
llmSelectionInfo.faq3Question: Does my choice affect my grades?
llmSelectionInfo.faq3Answer: No. Your AI preference has no impact on how your work is graded. All manual assessments remain the same.
llmSelectionInfo.faq4Question: Can I use different options for different courses?
llmSelectionInfo.faq4Answer: Currently, your AI choice applies to all of Artemis. Per-course settings may be added in the future.
